name: Oxford House
description: Oxford House is a national non-profit organization providing sober living housing for individuals recovering from drug and alcohol addiction. Founded in 1975, Oxford House operates over 2,900 democratically run, self-supporting homes nationwide. Each house provides a supportive, drug-free environment where residents can rebuild their lives while maintaining sobriety. The organization follows a proven model of peer support and mutual accountability, helping individuals transition to independent, substance-free living.
source: Verified from official website, Google Business listings, and multiple online directories
services: Sober living housing, peer support, recovery resources, transitional housing, addiction recovery support
eligibility: Individuals in recovery from drug and alcohol addiction, must be committed to sobriety
fees: Monthly rent varies by location, typically $400-800 per month
notes: Each house conducts its own interviews and votes on admitting new members. Houses are self-supporting and democratically run. Contact the Kentucky chapter for specific location availability and application process.
